required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Back and Neck Pain in Adolescence
clinical_study.official_title: Back and Neck Pain in Adolescence: A Prospective Cohort Study Using a German Version of the Young Spine Questionnaire

brief_summary.textblock: To validate the German version of the Young Spine Questionnaire (G-YSQ) and to study back and neck pain in adolescents between 10 and 16 years during one year by means of G-YSQ.

detailed_description.textblock:
In two settings (school, clinics) back and neck pain of 10 to 16 years old adolescents will be assessed by the German Version of the Young Spine Questionnaire at 6 points in time during one year.
Validity, reliability and responsiveness of the G-YSQ will be determined and the development of back and neck pain within a year will be described.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in a German Version of the Young Spine Questionnaire

study_pop.textblock: Adolescents between 10 and 16 years with and without back and neck pain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 10 to 16 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- younger than 10, older than 16

reference.citation: Lauridsen HH, Hestbaek L. Development of the young spine questionnaire. BMC Musculoskelet Disord. 2013 Jun 12;14:185. doi: 10.1186/1471-2474-14-185.
Wirth B, Knecht C, Humphreys K. Spine Day 2012: spinal pain in Swiss school children- epidemiology and risk factors. BMC Pediatr. 2013 Oct 5;13:159. doi: 10.1186/1471-2431-13-159.
Wirth B, Humphreys BK. Pain characteristics of adolescent spinal pain. BMC Pediatr. 2015 Apr 17;15:42. doi: 10.1186/s12887-015-0344-5.
